law.catch_line: This section applies only to the:...

text.section:
The Board of Trustees shall adopt regulations to allow a public employee organization to obtain, for a reasonable fee, each year:
the name and last known address of each individual during the last year who became a retiree or commenced receiving a vested allowance;
the name and last known address of each retiree or former member receiving a vested allowance who died in the last year; and
any change in address in the last year of a retiree or former member receiving a vested allowance.

section.section: Except as provided in § 21-128 of this title, before the release of a name, the Board of Trustees shall notify the individual of the provisions of this section.

If an individual notifies the Board of Trustees that the individual does not want the individual's name or address released to an employee organization, the Board of Trustees may not release the name or address.

text.section: An employee organization may not release any information that it receives under this section.
